favourite.article: I woke up this morning with a heavy heart ruminating over all the challenges that I have been going through over the past months. And before I could settle down to have my quiet time, the Holy Spirit just ministered this song to me and I started singing it. With these comforting words, I know I'm Safe in the arms of Jesus and sweetly my soul doth rest. Almighty God, Your word is yea and amen, it cannot return to You void. I have faith that I am safe in Your arms. No weapon formed against me shall prosper in the awesome name of Jesus.
This song reminds me of my fellow Spiritual Brother Ray Votaw who taught me God's word.
I love this song...am safe in the arms of my Saviour.

Safe in the arms of Jesus has blessed my heart this morning as I sit missing our dear Grandson Levi who went to heaven on April 4 2014. His life verse was Romans 8:18. He was A sweet witness to the saving grace of our Lord Jesus in whose loving arms he rests. Thank God for His unspeakable gift.

I have always loved The Lord and hymns are the most inspirational when one is deeply in prayer recognizing the presence and comfort of the Holy Spirit. This is where I am now, praying for a very very dear friend. The Holy Spirit popped this hymn in my heart and I just had to recall every single word in each stanza of the hymn. Now I know God has a word for me for my friend's situation. It is well so I no longer worry. Praise The Lord and His infinite wisdom. Amen.
Beautiful and peaceful song. I love it so!! I'm Safe! Safe! Safe! Thank You Father in the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth!!

I am learning into my counselling course of how important it is to have a secure attachment. Many don't. They can be fearful or avoidant. It reminded me of this hymn, Safe in the arms of Jesus. That is our secure attachment! While those we love may leave or pass on, God is our only security.

I was awoken with a heavy burden. I begun to talk to the Lord as l was not able to phone any one as it was rather late—11:15 pm. Furthermore, l was fed up of telling people about my worry, so l decided to pray. To the glory of God the Holy Spirit who is our great Comforter, gave me this profound hymn—Safe in the arms of Jesus. Then, l was given another one—Praise God from whom all blessing flow. Praise Him all creatures here below, Praise Him above ye heavenly host, Praise Father, Son and Holy Ghost. From that point my heaviness melted. Praise the Most High. I admonish you to cast all your cares on Jesus, as friends will fail you. But Jesus will never fail.

While praying this morning, I was asking the Father why did Jesus come to die for me personally. Though I know generally for humanity from sin but I wanted something more concrete that I could telling my children looking directly Into their eyes with conviction and a sense of who holds my hands in this seeming cool war going on around me. I heard Him say 'I AM THE DOOR'. I Rushed to understand the mystery from the Bible in John 10:1-9, my spirit sprung up with this song 'Safe in the arms of Jesus'. I say a very big thank you to the Spirit behind this song and the humble vessel that yielded to the call. For the owners of this site thanks for being the gatekeepers for God's people.

This hymn was written in 1869 in New York City. Reportedly, Mr. Doane brought the music to Mrs. Crosby and asked her to write words for it. "Let me hear it," she said. The blind woman sat attentively listening while he played his composition on a small organ. When he hand finished Mrs. Crosby told him: "That says we are safe in the arms of Jesus. Let me see what I can do with it." Half an hour later, she was back with the lyrics as we know them more than 100 years hence. - George Beverly Shea in "Songs that Lift the Heart" -------------------------- The 2nd 1/2 of the 1st stanza in the original says: Hark! ’tis the voice of angels, borne in a song to me. Over the fields of glory, over the jasper sea. --------------------------- The last line of the chorus originally says: sweetly my soul shall rest
Thank You Jesus. I know I'm safe in Your hands, come what may.

When you are discourage and tempted and tossed thinking all is lost there came Jesus with His gentle arms to shelter you and caused you to rest in His peace knowing that it's He that sustained us; always remember the foot print in the sand when you don't see it He carries you on His shoulder so that you would soar like an eagle.

I was thinking on the decadence of our generation, particularly how liberalism is eroding Christian values that built up nations. I whispered to the Lord to build up in me passionate hatred for whatever this generation accepts as good but which runs contrary to the teaching of Christ. And while I got to my office praying, this line 'Safe in the Arms of Jesus' flowed into my heart. I searched for it and it ministered greatly to my heart. It is an arsenal against the darts of corruption and immorality of all times. Surely Jesus is there to see us through whatever tries to corrupt our faith. Shalom

Jesus Lord is our Saviour. He loves all of us. When we are in great difficulties and stress or sickness He can only give us relief and take care about each of us. In this earth everything has been created by His plan and so He has a plan for everybody.
Thank You Jesus to be in Your safe hands and show us every day to go ahead with Your plans, not with our plans.

I bless the name of Almight God for His grace upon me. I am truely safe in the arms of His son Jesus. This hymn relieves me of earthly burdens and the pains of heart knowning that I am safe. Thank You Lord.
Great to be in His Arms day in and day out. Is there any other way to live?
Dedicated to the memory of my Dad: Elder JS Akinbola Akinremi, who transited mortality to immortality exactly 3 years ago.
Indeed, It is safe to be in His Arms every day of our life. I love You, Lord.

I was reading the verse 1Peter 3:20, "...eight souls, were brought safely through by water." and the words of this hymn came to me, Safe in the arms of Jesus. What a comfort to know Christ Jesus. What a sorrow that others don't.

First,I would like to give praise and honor to God Almighty, and our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ. Thanks to you also (Hymnal.Net) for being such a wonderful inspiration over the air waves into our homes, work places, and worship sites. Your music fills my heart and soul with joy and peace and a stressless release from the toils and snares and the many earthly burdens we face daily. Safe in the Arms Jesus was a hymn I heard over the air waves while station in Alaska with the United States Air Force Reserves during my annual two weeks tour. While sitting in my barracks(dormitory) room, your music...this hymn was sent by you or someone over the air waves. May God continue to bless Hymnal.Net, all of the hard working, dedicated employees and staff, and your untiring service to society...to the world.
Love and Peace Sam F. Logan

I love this song. Every anxious moment is nullified when my spirit echos this song. If the trials of life steal my rest, this song gives me peace and I sleep off peacefully , humming this song. Thank You Jesus for those who know Your heart and give us a glimpse of Your tender love.
I love this song as a young chorister and each time it is being rendered I always cry and now that I am close to 40 I still feel the same. Jesus is Lord.
I AGREE WITH THE 1ST COMMENT. Live and see every day of your life safe in the hands of your great guard (Lord Jesus)" No man can take u from His hands" so why shrink. EA.Daniel

Do not consider this as a hymn used during a funeral. Do not wait until you die to enjoy the arms of Jesus when you can enjoy them today. The hymns we sing in the home meetings need not be fully in line with the fellowship in the meeting. Do not be legal. The hymns we select depend fully on whether we have the Spirit or not. If in your daily life you let the Lord make home in you, and if you are being transformed into His image by beholding His glory with unveiled face, then He will lead you. You will sense the nourishing and comforting within. The Lord may give you a hymn. Then you come to the meeting. You may be the first one in the meeting, but you do not need to wait for others. You just begin to sing, "Safe in the arms of Jesus...." As you sing you bring the spiritual atmosphere into the meeting. Those who come later will join the singing and the meeting will begin spontaneously.
Source: Key Points on the Home Meetings, chapter 4.
